intro: Leucostegia pallida, commonly known as the pale leucostegia, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a smooth, glossy surface. Leucostegia pallida is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
